thread.title: govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry
thread.title_full: govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry

title: govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry
text:
govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry Neiko Creamer stands in has big Bama back Post to Facebook govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry Neiko Creamer stands in has big Bama back   WBIR.com: http://on.wbir.com/1LJsK93   Join the Conversation To   govols247: Vols use TE to prepare for Alabama's Henry Ryan Callahan, govols247.com 8:21 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Vols tight end Neiko Creamer has been simulating Alabama RB Derrick Henry in practice (Photo: govols247) 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
To prepare for the challenge of facing Alabama's Derrick Henry, Tennessee decided this week to use one of its tight ends to simulate the Crimson Tide's massive junior running back. 
Defensive coordinator John Jancek said Tuesday that the Vols temporarily have made redshirt freshman tight end Neiko Creamer a scout-team running back this week in hopes of giving their defense a fair representation of the 6-foot-3, 242-pound Henry leading up to their trip to eighth-ranked Alabama on Saturday. 
Tennessee has its own running back built similarly to Henry in starter Jalen Hurd, a 6-foot-4, 240-pound sophomore. But Jancek said Tuesday that the Vols' defensive players "don't really face" Hurd during the season.
